title: Introducing: Minni Lovelle
content:
With the year coming to a close, and ‘Sound of 2014’ lists beginning to be drawn up, more and more artists are bringing out their A game.

Minni Lovelle aka Yasemin Turan from Birmingham is not a name that I’d heard before, however after just one listen to her three track debut EP, there’s no doubting that this release is sure to prick up a few ears. Squeezing in somewhere between the elegant, soulful wanderings of London Grammar, and more single orientated chart success stories (or future success stories aka Vaults). Of the three tracks, Holes In My Suitcase showcases Turan’s sultry, on point vocals, layered over a sparse, glitchy beat, whereas lead single What I Knew is a straight up, no strings attached pop number, destined to be remixed hundreds of times for dancefloors around the UK. She may have seemingly sprung from nowhere, but Minni Lovelle is a name you’re going to want to remember.

Check out What I Knew and Holes In My Suitcase below, as well as the full EP under that.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
